page.title: 11continued
page.content: The{population}of the village was fairly constant at around 1200 for most of the last century and the first half of this, but it has increased dramatically since the 1960's, topping 3000 by 1981 and over 4000 at the time of writing. This change is due to the large amount of house-building during this period. The most impressive{building}in the village besides St.Mary's Church is Wootton House. Built in the late 17th century for the Monoux family, the two storey building of red brick (later plastered) is now privately owned. There are several 17th, 18th and 19th century cottages remaining in the village although many of them have been much altered.
